author: Special Correspondent
text:
The City Police are on the lookout for the owner of the car that was found at Uthangudi with a fake registration number on Friday.

Besides the fake number plate, the presence of around Rs. 66,000 cash left in the vehicle and the non-appearance of the owner, Mani Sekar alias ‘Pulsar’ Mani, before the police after the seizure of the vehicle, have strengthened the suspicion of the police that he had been up to some “mischief” in the city.

The police said that the vehicle had come from Vellore, where Sekar was staying.

In his confession, the acting driver had reportedly told the police he was asked the park the vehicle at Uthangudi and wait till Sekar returned.

The police claimed that Sekar had done the same a couple of times in the past too – of leaving the car on the city outskirts and being picked up and dropped back at the spot on a two-wheeler.

“However, the driver was unaware of what was Sekar up to in the city,” the police said.

Stating that Sekar was involved in a few criminal cases, the police said that only after they nabbed him the mystery behind the seizure of the car with fake registration number and use of five mobile phones and 10 SIM cards could be unravelled.
title: Police on the lookout for absconding man
